bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21: US District Court, Western Division of Washington, Seattle

org.orgName: United States District Court Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of CHIN WAH HING For a Writ of Habeas Corpus.} No. 3378 PETITION FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
To the honorable Jeremiah Neterer, District Judge:

Comes now, Chin Wah Hing, petitioner, and petitions this Court to issue a Writ of Habeas Corpus to inquire into the cause of the detention of one Chin Doe Tung by Hon. Henry M. White Commissioner of Immigration, at Seattle, Washington, and shows to the Court as follows:

I. That Chin Doe tung is the lawful blood son of your petitioner, eighteen years of age, and is now detained at the at the United States Immigration Station at Seattle, Washington, by Hon. Henry M. White, Commissioner of Immigration at Seattle, in the proceedings from the application of the said Chin Doe Tung to be admitted into the United States as the minor son of your petitioner who is a recognized legitimate merchant within the meaning of the laws of the United States and the treaties between the United States and China governing the admission of the subjects of China into the United States, being a member of the Kee Fong Company, 667 King Street, Seattle, Washington.

II. That the said Chin Doe Tung is imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by the said Commissioner of Immigration at
said Immigration Station; that he has not been committed and is not detained by virtue of any judgement, decree, final order or process issued by a Court or Judge of the United States, in a case where such courts or judge have exclusive jurisdiction under the laws of the UNited States, or have acquired exclusive jurisdiction by commencement of legal proceedings in such a court nor is he detained by virtue of the final judgement or decree of a court or competent tribunal of civil or criminal jurisdiction, or the final order of such a tribunal made in the special proceedings instituted for any cause except to punish him for contmept; or by virtue of an execution or other process issues upon such a judgement, decree or final order; or by virtue of a warrant issued from any court upon an indictment or information.

III. That the court or pretense of the imprisonment or restraint of the said Chin Doe Tung, according to the best knowledge and beleif of your petitioner, that the said Commissioner ruled that the said Chin Doe Tung was an alien Chinese person, not a member of any of the exempt classes of Chinese entitled to come into or remain in the United States, and accordingly refused him admission, from which finding an appeal was taken to the Secretary of Labor and said appeal was thereupon denied by the Secretary of Labor on the __ day of June, 1916; that the decision of the said officials denying admission is upon the ground and for the reason that the said Chin Doe Tung was married before coming to the United States and has a wife in China, which ruling is illegal, wrongful, contrary to the laws of the United States and the Government of China respecting and governing the admission and exclusion
of the subjects of China into and from the United States.

IV. That the facts developed by the hearings in this matter by said Immigration officials are insufficient to justify the decision that the said Chin Doe Tung is not of the said exempt classes and the said decision is arbitrary, and also contrary to law; that the said immigration officials in making said findings, aside fromo being contrary to law and treaty, greatly abused their discretion in holding that the said Chin Doe Tung was not ofthe exempt classes.

V. That the said Chin Doe Tung is being restrained of his liberty without due process of law, in violation of the provisions of the constitution of the United States, the laws and treaties governing such cases made and provided; that he is wrongfully, illegally and arbitarily restrained of his liberty, and that the said Immigration officials are about to deport him and that unless this Court intervenes he will be deported forthwith.

Wherefore your petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus may issue, directed to Hon. Henry M. White, Commissioner of Immigration at Seattle, Washington, commanding him to have the body of the said Chin Doe Tung before Hon. Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of the United States District Court, Western District of Washington, Northern Division, at the Federal Court Building in Seattle. Washington, at 10 o'clock A.M. July __, 1916, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Chin Doe Tung, togetjer withh the time and cause of his detention.
Dated June __, 1916. Chin Wah Hing Petitioner.
